bibl.title: Biennial Report of the Secretary of State of the State of Nebraska

body.seg: Biennial Report OF THE SECRETARY OF STATE OF THE State of Nebraaha FOR TWENTY-FOUR MONTHS ENDING JUNE SO, 1940 :. v. : :,,:;:.;^ ¦?. v '.'¦¦'¦¦/¦ ¦' . .:-..; Harry R. Swanson, Secretary of State TO THE GOVERNOR

Department of State (;j Lincoln, Nebraska December 1, 1940. To His Excellency, R. L. Cochran, Governor of the State of Nebraska Sir: £ y Conforming to the Statutes ot the State of Nebraska, I submit, herewith my report as Secretary of State, for the State of Nebraska for the twenty-four months ending June 30th, 1940. This report sets forth the amount of receipts and expenditures of this department, tog-ether with a list of companies licensed under Chapter 45, Section 113 of the Compiled Statutes of Nebraska for 1929. I,: Respectfully submitted, HARRY R. SWANSON, Secretary of State. ¦-, -'¦-. ¦¦¦ THE ACORN PRESS. LINCOLN. NEBRASKA I

FINANCIAL STATEMENT OF HARRY R. SWANSON Secretary of State Tbis office collects fees for filing articles of incorporation, corpora - tion permits, notary public commissions, registration of brands, certi - cates of transcripts, trade marks, loan licenses under provision of House Roll No. 44, Session Laws of 1915. ¦ \ BIENNIAL REPORT OP THE SECRETARY OF STATE 1 SMALL LOAN COMPANIES ! Section 45-113, Compiled Statutes of Nebraska for 1928, provides I for the licensing of loan agents or agencies and is designed to regulate | the loaning of money in smal quantities upon chattel securities. The } bond to be given by the company is in the sum of $2,000.00, to be \ renewed and filed annually on March Ist.
